intro: Alyxia sharpei, commonly known as the red-berried alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds and can persist on the plant for several months. Alyxia sharpei thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in dry woodlands.
